description.narrative: Kvinna till Kvinna and its partner organisations in Bosnien and Hercegovina shall contribute to improve the institutional responsiveness in combating impunity for perpetrators of sexual violence. This shall be achieved by support to civil society organisations in BiH to monitor institutions and Courts implementation of national laws. The rights of victims shall also be in focus by enhancing their need of safety and an equal right and access to justice.. The project will support selected women's organisations in monitoring the institutions actions in combating GBV, including trials, the police interrogation methods and social institutions' ability to support the victims. The Project relies on on a right based approach focusing on the victims. The Project is a complement to a two years contribution (55060039) in cooperation with DCAF (The Geneva Centre for the Democratic Control of Armed Forces) and HJPC, High Judicial and Prosecutorial Council of Bosnia and Herzegovina i BiH. This project, also supported by Norway aims at supporting and strengthening Working both with the legal system and civil society in parallel enhances the chance of reaching a change ie improved witness protection, a more victim oriented focus strengthened referral chain - from police interrogation, social protection to court proceedings improving the rights of those having been subject to gender based violence.

Kvinna till Kvinna och dess partnerorganisationer i Bosnien och Hercegovina ska bidra till att förbättra det institutionella gensvaret i kampen mot straffrihet för förövare av könsbaserat våld. Detta ska uppnås genom att stödja civilsamhällesorganisationer i BiH i att bevaka och följa upp myndigheters och rättsinstansers följsamhet till nationella lagar. Offrens rättigheter ska också bevakas utifrån behov av skydd och jämlik tillgång till rättvisa. Projektet kommer att stödja att urval av kvinnoorganisationer för att bevaka myndigheternas insatser för att bekämpa GBV, inklusive rättsprocesser i domstolar, polisväsendets gensvar och sociala instansers möjlighet till stöd för offren. Projektet vilar på en rättighetsbaserad inriktning med fokus på offren. Projektet är ett komplement till en tvåårig insats (55060039) i samarbete med DCAF (The Geneva Centre for the Democratic Control of Armed Forces) and HJPC, domar-och åklagarämbetet i BiH. Det projektet syftar till att stödja, stärka och upprätthålla långsiktiga förbättringar för en icke-diskriminerande, tillgänglig och objektiv rättvisa med ett tydligt jämställdhetsperspektiv. Genom att arbeta både med rättsväsendet och med civilsamhället ökar möjligheten att uppnå en förändring dvs bättre skydd av vittnen, ökat fokus på offer, en stärkt kedja av omhändertagande av offer - från polisförhör till socialt skydd och domstolsutslag som ökar de utsattas rättigheter.

Women's rights in Bosnia and Herzegovina are strengthened (specifically in regard to victims of GBV enjoying fair and equal protection and access to justice)Increased prioritisation of women's human rights by governments (specifically related to the institutional response to combating and prevention of GBV).

description.narrative: The final reporting submitted from KtK covering the period 2015-2017 was comprehensive and followed the agreement set up and the LFA/RAF and the logical framework set for the programme and its interventions. The monitoring element of the programme (focus on influencing and change institutional behaviors) was done in close collaboration with a number of local women's organisations all over Bosnia and Hercegovina (hereinafter BiH). Assistance has been povided to vicitms and survivor of domestic violence. No doubt the monitoring of the Court system and different courts in the country has had a amjor positive imprint and results/impacts. Annual monitoring reviews are recognised and seen, and developments followed by the legal system. Enforcements of already existing laws and their implementation has improved over the years. Concrete proposal to change laws (in particular in RS) to adopt the Criminal Code, stricter penalties for crimes committed was indeed adopted in late 2017 (RS). But also in the Federation there has been achievements, especially when it comes to the impositions of sanctions for domestic violence cases (aggravating circumstances considered). Better application of international standards such as relating to Istanbul Convention etc. has also been achieved. Integration into domestic laws, protection system (better coordianted efforts) and Multi-Sectorial institutional suppport are other measures that KtK's work has lead to. The establishment of Multi-Sectorial team across all sectors in RS and FBIH inclduing Brcko (who by the way also managed to get their first Law on Protection from Domestic Violence entered into the legislative procedure). These combined platforms will contribute to improving prevention of GBV and Domestic Violence in BIH, protection of victims and survivors as well as prosecution of perpetrators. LAws are gradually harmonised against the Instanbul Convention (from 2013). Adding to the above, KtK has also in collaboration with AGE (Gender Equality Agency, BiH) been able to realize and follow up the Law on Gender Equality in Bih (law from 2003) and to provide shelter(s), psycho-social and legal support to women in need.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
